results.title: Rhonda’s story : spoken by Ada Peterson
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Speaking for her sister, Rhonda, Ada Peterson gives us some insight into the anguish and confusion of being a member of the ‘Stolen Generation’. While Rhonda understands too well the psychological trauma experienced by the parents whose children were taken, she doesn’t understand why they refuse to talk about it today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Ride in the whirlwind
results.creator_credit: Monte Hellman, Jack Nicholson and Proteus Films
results.brief_description: When three innocent cowboys are mistaken for stagecoach robbers, they are forced to become fugitives until they clear themselves of suspicion. Before Jack Nicholson achieved fame in “Easy Rider”, his electrifying talent was evident as the writer, co-producer and star of this taut, highly charged western thriller. Co-starring Cameron Mitchell, Millie Perkins and Harry Dean Stanton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Monte Hellman, Jack Nicholson and Proteus Films

results.title: Richard et Cosima
results.creator_credit: Peter Patzak, Dietrich Mack and Rene Letzgus
results.brief_description:
Having persuaded the King that a new theater should be built to accomodate the performances of his tetralogy, Wagner and Cosima settle in a villa near Bayreuth, called ‘Wahnfried’. The film recounts Wagner’s often stormy relationship with Cosima.

Credits: Producers, Rene Letzgus, Dietrich mack ; director, Peter Patzak ; writers, Reinard Baumgart ; photography, Anton Peschke ; music, Peter Zwetkoff.
Cast: Otto Sander, Tatja Seibt, Fabienne Babe.

results.title: Richard Takes a Train Ride
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A junior school film in the Social Studies series. Describes events on a rail trip from Murray Bridge, on the Victoria-South Australian border to Adelaide; purchase of tickets; work of porters; views of countryside en route; work of the conductor; tunnels; and finally, arrival at Adelaide.

results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Rich & Poor: What Can We Do?
results.creator_credit: Ian McFarlane, Alan Hart and Film Inc.
results.brief_description: In a mutual struggle for global survival the rich world and the poor world must work together. The basic problem is food and lasting change requires developmental aid. From “Five minutes to midnight”.

results.title: Riches of the earth
results.creator_credit: Barry Helmer, Sidney Goldsmith, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Colourful animation illustrates how Canada’s underground resources took shape through geological ages, and how theses riches of the earth have become our raw materials. We see the formation, by fire, water, wind and ice, of the earth’s crust, with its wealth of minerals, coal, arable land and water.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Christina Brim’s mum died recently and a lot of memories and stories have been going around in my head. Brims pays tribute to her mother, the glue that kept her ‘large mob’ together and cohesive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Brims, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Rice harvest
results.creator_credit: Bob Lower, Norma Bailey, Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Each fall, for generations, the families of the Pauingassi band have camped by northern Manitoba lakes, and combed the reedy shores with brooms, paddles and baskets for manomin - wild rice. The trade with the bush pilot begins the process by which an Indian staple and sacred crop becomes a white man’s luxury food. A quiet but haunting film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Lower, Norma Bailey, Jerry Krepakevich and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: Each fall, for generations, the families of the Pauingassi band have camped by northern Manitoba lakes, and combed the reedy shores with brooms, paddles and baskets for manomin - wild rice. results.title: Richard III [McKellen]
results.creator_credit: Richard Loncraine, Stephen Bayly, Lisa Katselas Pare and Richard III Film Company
results.brief_description: Ian McKellen reprises his earlier role as the charismatic but machiavellian Richard of Gloucester, who uses any means necessary to assume the role of King. Director Loncraine provides a contemporary setting of the 1930’s fascist era, providing Shakespear’s traditional tale with a powerfully symbolic and decadent background. Cast includes Annette Bening, Jim Broadbent, Robert Downey Junior, Nigel Hawthorne, Kristin Scott Thomas, Maggie Smith and John Wood.
